intro: Elaphrium apterum, commonly known as the slender elaphrium, is a small, herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features delicate, finely divided leaves. Its flowers are small and white, clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Elaphrium apterum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along streambanks.
